The International School of Moscow Part of The British Schools Group
Dear Parents,
A Happy New Year to you all. I hope that 2014 proves to be positive, productive, happy and most importantly, healthy for your family.
Term Two has started smoothly and we have enjoyed welcoming several new students to ISM. I am sure that we will all work hard to ensure that new families are welcomed into our community.
The update this week is short but sweet! (I am aware that a lot of information has been sent out to parents this week due to the new term).
Academic Calendar 2014-15
I am pleased to confirm the following dates for next year. The structure is very similar to the current year. You can now plan those exciting trips home or to new exciting places!

Music Department Ensembles.
Upper Primary Orchestra/Band (Year 4-6)
From this term onwards, Orchestra will focus on our Upper Primary phase and will run during the first half of Upper Primary Lunchtime 12.40-13.15. This session, directed by Mr. Riley-Gledhill is open to anyone learning orchestral instruments from beginner to advanced in all instrumental families (Woodwind, Strings, Brass and Percussion). Students interested should remember to bring their instrument on Fridays!
Senior Choir (Year 6-11)
With the upcoming Senior production on the horizon, Senior Choir will continue rehearsals after half term. (Thursday March 6th 15.30-17.00). Choir will be open to both existing and new members and the invitation to join will be extended to Year 6 and above. More details will follow before resumption.
Main School Events – Term Two
Please do be aware of the main events listed below. It is important to note the re-scheduling of the Senior Production and Secondary International Week. Also, that the Secondary PTCs for Term 2 will take place on Tuesday the 8th and Wednesday the 9th of April, not on the 6th and 7th of April as stated in the curriculum letters that went home this week. Apologies for that misinformation.

Well done- Junior Varsity Girls Lions Basketball team
Friday 17th and Saturday 18th January saw the Junior Varsity Girls Lions make the short trip to AAS to take part in the fourth annual Penguin International Basketball Tournament. The event played host to a large number of American Schools from around the globe including schools from Casablanca, Morocco and Warsaw. Well done to the team on reaching the semi finals before suffering an overtime defeat 16-15. Please see the full news article on our website!
We hope that you have a wonderful weekend.
Paul Seedhouse
